newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Grain up 7.78 pct on growth prospects.
newsitem.headline: Grain up 7.78 pct on growth prospects.

text.p: Shares of Ceylon Grain Elevators Ltd rose 7.78 percent, or 1.75 rupees, to 24.25 in early Thursday trading, brokers said.
"Investors expect the company to see good profit growth in 1997 due to the steady world market price of grain and improved local power supply," said a broker who declined to be identified.
The company, which mills animal feed and grows day-old chicks, was badly hit in 1996 by the high international price of grain and a crippling drought in Sri Lanka which led to power cuts.
